texts.text: Select the eraser for the table
We offer training for people who use and configure LifeCompanion (professional speech therapists, occupational therapists, educators, caregivers, etc.)
Executes the actions of the box/list/link according to the setting made in the box lists configuration view.
Select this profile and open the list of associated configurations
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the left of the screen
Speech synthesis using SAPI voices installed on the system.\nThe installed voices must be available to the system and can be 32/64 bit.\nSAPI voices do not take the "height" parameter into account.
Sets the delay with a change of window opacity in use mode when the mouse enters and exits the window.\nDecreasing the value makes the change happen faster.
Corrects major visual confusions between letters or sets of letters
Contains all actions relating to the text.\nWrite text, delete it, edit it...
No special characteristics: completely configurable, its content, style and actions are free.
Allows you to change the position of the text relative to the image (above, below, etc.)
Request a simple operation to edit
Unable to load the plugin because your version of LifeCompanion is too old.
Are you sure you want to delete the "{}" configuration?\nIf this configuration is the currently loaded configuration, it will also be lost.
URL to open (must be valid, e.g.: "http://google.fr")
Remove a grid from the stack
Allows you to create a configuration starting from a model selected from a list of models offered by LifeCompanion. The configuration can then be modified to be suitable.
Allows you to create a “storage” key for the entered text. On selection, this "opens" this note, on the next selection, it "closes" the note and thus allows its text to be kept for later.
Puts the current editor's text on the computer's clipboard. This then allows, thanks to the software's paste function, to use the text from the editor.
Allows you to write the text in the key that launches the action in the editor, then to pronounce it
Pauses the current scroll. Scrolling will resume from the beginning at the next selection.
Move the LifeCompanion window to a desired location (center, right, etc.)
If enabled, pressing the key will display the image in full screen. When pressed again, the image will be hidden.

Different formats are offered:
 - Online video training (autonomous) [200€/person]
 - Group face-to-face training [400€/person]
 - Tailor-made training on site [on quote]
Create a ZIP file of logs
Corrects errors in sequencing letters in words, particularly sequences of consonants, vowels, consonants
Spells all text currently displayed in the editor with the selected speech synthesis.
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the top of the screen
You do not have access to Makaton Bank

Configuration in profile
"{}", modified on {} to "{}"

Imported configuration
"{}", modified on {} to "{}"

What do you want to do ?
Place the text to the right of the image
Allows you to rotate the image 90° to the right
Adds a text editor, it can be added to a key, or directly in the configuration. It allows you to visualize the written text.
Restore the default color of the key
This event is generated at the end of a sequence and therefore allows you to add subsequent actions, for example returning to the sequence selection or even pronouncing an end message.
Corrects the main auditory confusions between phonemes (uses orthographic transcriptions of phonemes)
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the bottom of the screen
Set the color of visual feedback for scrolling
Allows you to correct an omission of one or more letters, as well as the omission of a space or an apostrophe.
Write the predicted word entered in the key.\nIf no words are predicted, nothing will be written in the editor. This action only makes sense if it is added to a word prediction key.
Unable to open "{}" for unknown reason

Allows you to select the global selection mode for this configuration.\nThe selection mode determines how the user will activate the configuration keys, depending on their level of access to the computer: selection by scrolling, direct with a pointer, with time delay, etc.
To enter edit mode,\nplease enter the result of the following operation: {} + {} = ?
If enabled, the configuration will not be distorted to fill the window.\nOn the other hand, if disabled, the configuration will be stretched to completely fill the space in the window.
Select the pencil for the table
Save the action and close the actions menu
Imports a user profile from an "lcp" file and adds it to the LifeCompanion user profile list.
Opens the menu to be able to increase the size of an element in the grid

When you have multiple grids in edit mode, it can be convenient to quickly display another grid.\n\nIf a key contains an action such as "Go to grid" or "Go to key", simply click on the key while holding down the "ALT" key, the destination grid will then be displayed.
Fixes adding an extra letter inside a word (all letters of the alphabet)
Allows you to record a sound with the computer microphone and then play that sound. Pauses scrolling until playback is finished.
This extension will be loaded the next time the application is started, it can then be used
The virtual mouse movement speed (the higher the value, the faster the mouse will move across the screen)
Allows you to go to the previous grid in a selected grid stack.\nIf the selection mode is a scrolling mode, scrolling will begin at the start of the next grid.
Sets the window opacity in use mode.\nDecreasing the value allows you to obtain a transparent window, in order to see the elements behind the window, very useful in "virtual keyboard" mode.
Extension in error: loading the extension failed, an automatic update may possibly correct the problem
Change the size of the selection outline

In LifeCompanion, you can define element templates on your profile that you can reuse in other configurations. For example, it allows you to use a keyboard that would suit different users.

It is very simple to create your own models:
 1. Select the element for which you want to create the model (any element of the configuration can become a model, key, stack, etc...)
 2. Enter a name for this element if you haven't already done so (don't panic! If you haven't chosen a name, you can always change it later)
 3. Click "Set as template", the template appears in your list
 4. You can now use the created template in another configuration with a simple drag and drop.
Allows you to adjust additional parameters for the image (ratio, rotation, etc.)

In order to add the template into your current configuration, you can drag it to the target configuration item.\nIt will be automatically added to the selected element or directly to the configuration.
Allows you to change the type of virtual mouse.
Corrects typing errors on the Azerty keyboard, allows you to manage the permutation of nearby letters on the keyboard
Save the event and close the events menu
Allows you to change the image bank of the configuration by trying to replace the images already present with those from another image bank.
Opens the menu to add a key next to the selected key and shift the grid keys
Add a personal word (Enter to validate)
Allows you to select keys by first selecting a grid column, then selecting a key in that column.\nHover actions are triggered when the key is scrolled.
Allows you to go to the next grid in a selected grid stack. If the currently displayed grid is the last grid, then goes to the first grid in the grid stack.
Unable to export configuration grids to PDF
If the key is blocked, then it will not have its usual behavior. For example, you can block the "Enter" key if you no longer want to have a line break when you press it.
Time (in seconds) spent on each square while scrolling.
Adds a key from above to the selected key. This will shift the grid keys down and remove the last key
Enable/disable replacing one color with another
The size of a configuration is by default automatically determined and adapted to the window. However, if you want to add "empty" borders around a configuration, it is possible to adjust it manually.
If enabled, a space is automatically added after the written word.
Import a “txt” file containing a list of words to prioritize (one word per line)
Virtual mouse (pointing scrolling by crossed lines)
Replacing an element in a grid
Add a key, this key will contain words automatically determined by word prediction
Saves a PDF containing an image of the current configuration as a PDF. For example, allows you to save the configuration when elements are dynamically changed.
Create emergency backups when deleting/importing configurations/profiles
Contains time-related event triggers. For example to trigger an event at a given time, or every 5 minutes...
Returns to the previous configuration if the configuration was loaded following the "Change configuration" action.
Allows you to go to the previous element (the grid, the grid stack...)\nIf this function is used several times, this will bring up the history of movements in the elements of the application.
Allows you to fill a selected box with the contents of that box.
Speech synthesis using the "pico2wave" command on Unix systems (tested on Ubuntu)
When the key is selected, the video will play in full screen. The full screen will be automatically closed at the end of the video or any mouse or keyboard press.
Allows you to automatically position the window on the screen when starting the configuration.
Starts the sequence associated with the current box (if the box is of type "List of sequences")
Add a key, this key will contain letters which will be automatically determined by letter prediction
Allows you to send feedback on the prediction. The text currently entered in the test along with the results will be sent.
Allows you to carry out a delay of a chosen duration between two actions. This allows you to wait a certain amount of time before executing an action.
Allows you to manage text styles: add, delete or modify existing styles
Are you sure you want to remove the "{}" style, this will remove the style from all components that use it.
If enabled, then corrections will appear with a different color than predictions

Here you can train the prediction with custom text. This will have the same effect as if the user entered this text themselves, therefore the prediction will adapt to the given text.\nWarning: training the prediction several times with the same text or with texts containing errors could distort the words proposed.
Moves to the next keys in the currently displayed list. When the end of the list is reached, the action no longer has an effect.
Generates an event when a defined time of day is reached.
If activated, the word can be displayed in the predictions, regardless of the validation rules for a word.
Add a row from a key
Generates an event when between {} and {}.

Sclera asbl promotes communicative and cognitive accessibility by:
 - raise awareness and inform
 - develop and offer tools
 - give advice
Creative Commons License (BY-NC)
Click to select an item from the drop-down list
Inverts the image on the horizontal axis

If enabled, prevents the user from simply returning to edit mode: a simple random math operation will be displayed and the user must enter the result to be able to access edit mode. Used to prevent a user who does not have access to edit mode from opening it unintentionally.
Will allow you to select the keyboard key by pressing it
Add an image to the gallery
Allows you to go to the next grid in a selected grid stack.\nIf the selection mode is a scrolling mode, scrolling will begin at the start of the next grid.
Change the text in the key "{}" to "{}"
You must wait {} seconds before printing again
Contains the current year in a readable format.
Contains the current month in a readable format.
Lower a grid into a pile
========= THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE =========\nLifeCompanion is developed under its own license, but uses external libraries in order to be developed. The following list contains the items used.
Opens the advanced settings of the selected text-to-speech
Displays the different steps of the currently selected sequence (updated based on progress).
Hides the button at the top right of the configuration to switch to full screen mode.
Allows you to configure the virtual mouse, which can be used using the "Mouse Actions" actions in the "Computer Access" category
Change the key type to multiple keys.
Name of the parent grid of the element currently hovered over (by mouse in direct selection, or while scrolling for other modes)
Allows you to go up one level in the grids.\nIf the currently selected grid is the highest, this action will have no effect.
Generates an event when the defined day of the week is reached.

Allows you to simulate holding or releasing a key on the keyboard. This can for example be used to hold a function key (Ctrl, Shift, Alt, etc.). The first press triggers the hold of the key, and the second releases it. This action does not cause characters to repeat when used with keys that are not function keys.
Speaks a chosen text with the currently selected speech synthesis.
Save and close the style screen
If activated, the user mode window will automatically be in full screen when launched.
Deletes the current user profile configuration.
Change configuration by opening another profile configuration.\nWarning: this will only work if the configuration is still present in the profile.
Allows you to change the voice used by the synthesis, if when the action is executed the voice does not exist, this action has no consequences.
You have {} unsaved modification(s) in the current configuration, these will be lost.\nDo you really want to continue?
Enter the identifier of the extension to install

The ARASAAC portal offers graphic resources as well as materials that facilitate communication for people with difficulties in this area. This project was funded by the Department of Education, Culture and Sports of the Aragonese Government and coordinated by the Department's General Directorate of Innovation, Equality and Participation.\nCreative Commons License (BY-NC-SA)
Change the color of a note activation
Automatically display the system's virtual keyboard on tablet
Select all items in current folder
Speech synthesis using SAPI voices installed on Windows.\nThe installed voices must be available to the system and can be 32/64 bit.\nSAPI voices do not take the "height" parameter into account.
Generates an event if the configuration is started on {} and the time {}:{} is reached.
Contains event triggers related to user control, keyboard or mouse. For example contains a way to react to long presses, keyboard keys, etc...
Write and pronounce the text in the key
Saves the editor text in a .txt file which will be in a chosen folder. The created text file will be named after the configuration name and date.
{} word(s) have been favored in the dictionary.
To start using LifeCompanion, you can
No existing profiles.\nYou can create a new one to use LifeCompanion.
LifeCompanion being free, training is an integral part of the economic model in order to ensure its maintenance and sustainability, training is therefore also supporting the future of LifeCompanion!

Opacity of the window in use mode when the mouse leaves the window.\nDecreasing the value allows you to obtain a transparent window, in order to see the elements behind the window, very useful in "visual keyboard" mode.
Deletes the last added entry. The deleted entry does not depend on the cursor position.
{} could not be installed correctly because it is not possible to perform installation tasks specific to this operating system.
This event is generated when the start of the current list is reached and the user asks again to go to the previous item.
The color of the virtual mouse cursor.
This extension will be deleted the next time the application is started, it can no longer be used
The word currently being written or completed in the text editor
Import a list of words to deprioritize/prioritize
Allows you to symmetrically invert the image horizontally
Generates an event when you are within a defined time interval of the day.
Clears a selected box (erases image, text and style).
Restarts scrolling. This returns to the start of the currently scrolling grid.
Allows you to modify the spacing of the placement aid grid.\nThe larger the space, the easier it will be to align the elements. On the other hand, you will have less freedom in investment.
Sends an event at a regular interval as long as LifeCompanion is running (the first event is sent when the configuration is launched).
Enable/disable writing all subsequent entries in uppercase. This action does not automatically turn off after the next entry like "Next letter capitalized" does
Set the background color of the configuration
Key whose press will be simulated
Allows you to change the drawing of the virtual mouse cursor.
Adds a key, this key is empty and has no particular function.

In LifeCompanion it is possible to choose to launch a configuration directly in use mode at launch.
This is very useful if the user is not going to use LifeCompanion's edit mode.

There is a configuration to launch automatically per profile, represented by a star. It will be launched automatically for the last opened profile.

Do you have a lot of images in your gallery and you're having trouble finding your way through them?\nWith folders, you can organize your gallery however you want. It is possible to create as many folders and subfolders as you want, then simply select the images to move, and drag and drop onto the destination folder. If you made a mistake, simply drag the image onto the red arrow so that it goes back to the parent folder.\nWhen you import images into your gallery, you can go directly to the desired folder, the imported images will be added there.
Displays the LifeCompanion Tips and Tricks window.
When a selected keyboard key is pressed. The event is sent when the key is pressed, not when it is released.
Allows you to enable the display of images in the text editor.\nIf enabled, communication keys with an image will automatically add the image in addition to the text when writing in the editor.
Event triggered when text-to-speech is disabled
Move the item up in the list
Opens/closes the list of elements of the current configuration.\nAllows you to search for an element by name, or select a hidden element.
The profile level is used to show or hide elements of the configuration interface.\nThe interface will therefore be simpler if you are a beginner, and more complete if you are an expert.
Allows you to select the voice to use.\nA voice is always associated with its engine. Each engine can offer a set of voices, the rendering of one voice to another can be completely different.
Change the time before taking into account a second press
Generates an event when {} is between {} and {}.
Be careful, you are about to delete user data (dictionary, model, configuration). This action is not reversible.
Setting up scroll pointing with crossed lines

By default, LifeCompanion configurations are launched in full screen when in use mode.\nThis may not be suitable, especially when LifeCompanion is used to access the computer. It is therefore possible to adjust the parameters of the configuration window: deactivate the full screen, adjust its size and choose an initial positioning.\nThis configuration can also be modified during use using the "Move window" or "Enable/disable full screen" actions.

It is entirely possible to add batteries into grids.
This is very practical if you want to have certain keys visible and accessible all the time, while varying only part of a grid.
In order to add a stack to a grid, you can first enlarge the grid key that will receive your stack. Once expanded, simply drag and drop the stack into this key. You now have a stack in a grid!

You can therefore add several grids in this stack, and thus change only a sub-part of your main grid (thanks to the "Go to grid" actions).
Change the trigger for activating selection mode
Replicates the mouse wheel up action (to move up in a scrollable item)
Open the gallery to select an image for this item
Please note, this key has no action or type of key, it could have no use in use mode...
Changes the style of a chosen key, replaces the existing style with a chosen style.
Allows you to open an Internet address in the system's default Internet browser.
Allows you to move to the next step in the current sequence
\non several lines to know how the text is displayed...
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the top right of the screen
Overlay the text in the center on top of the image

Allows you to rearrange keys of the same type based on the characters currently entered in the editor. Differs from "Automatic predicted character" in that the characters proposed are among keys of the same type and not free.
Action intended to be associated with a key list key, in order to select the sublist or link displayed.
Delete the row of the selected item
You have {} unsaved modification(s) in the current configuration.\n{}
Correct confused verbal/nominal inflections at the end of words (typically gender/number agreements as well as conjugations)

Allows you to create a shortcut on the desktop to directly open this configuration in use mode from the desktop.\nThis allows the launch of a specific configuration to be integrated into the system icons.
More configuration on the LifeCompanion platform directory
Deletes all text currently present in the editors.
Save the board image to a chosen folder

Allows you to configure the virtual mouse that can be used using actions in the "Virtual mouse actions (directional pointing)","Virtual mouse movement (directional pointing)" categories of the "Computer access" category
This event is generated at the end of a timer and therefore allows you to add subsequent actions, for example emit a sound or display a message.
Enable/disable images in a text editor
Add a key from the left
Delete a row from a key
Do you still want to close LifeCompanion?
Memory used by the JVM: {}/{}\nMaximum available memory: {}
Deletes the selected image for this item
Export of lists - action - event - variable
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the bottom right of the screen
Enable the use of a classic distance
Allows you to add a user profile: create a new profile, import it from a file, etc.
Sub-step (based on the last step which was not a sub-step)
Reduces the size of the right-selected item. This will add elements to the right to fill the space
Allows you to adjust the size of the scroll progress bar.\nThe higher the value, the greater the visual feedback will be.
When capital letters are disabled for the current configuration.

You have reached the maximum number of LifeCompanion installations that can use Makaton Bank with your member account. You can log in or create an account on the LifeCompanion platform to remove installations. You can also contact us if you would like us to do this for you.
Contains the day of the week in a readable format.

Allows you to display the vocabulary of the key lists configured on this configuration. Please note, the content is only updated by LifeCompanion based on navigation in the vocabulary tree, any element configured on this key impacts the key as such and not its associated vocabulary.
Allows you to hide the mouse pointer, very useful when using certain pointing devices or in particular configurations.
Allows you to make a link to another grid. This is useful for moving from key lists to specific grids.
Play a sound in LifeCompanion from an audio file (mp3, wav) (if the sound is not muted). Pauses scrolling until playback is finished.
Memory used by the JVM: {}/{}\nMaximum available memory: {}
Extension "{}" ({}) added successfully. This extension will be loaded the next time you start the application.
The comment has been sent, thank you!
There are {} unsaved modification(s) to the current configuration.\nDo you want to save the configuration before launching use mode?
This profile already exists in LifeCompanion.\nIf you import it, the existing profile will be overwritten and replaced.\nAre you sure you still want to import the profile?
Allows you to add/remove lines to the selected grid.\nRows are added/removed at the bottom of the grid.
Allows you to switch from “Use” mode to “Edit” mode directly from an action. This action will be carried out without requesting a confirmation code if it is activated.
Cancels and closes the events menu
Displays the grid that contains the selected key.\nIf the selection mode is a scrolling mode, scrolling will resume at the selected key.
Search for an event by name or description
Time (in seconds) spent additionally on the first key when scrolling.\nAllows the user to have more time when starting to scroll.
Check for updates on next startup
Allows you to select the trigger device for moving to the next element: a mouse click or a keyboard key
The last word completed in the text editor
Extension "{}" ({}) was not loaded because this extension is already loaded with the same or higher version.
Problem importing words, please check the file

The configuration has {} unsaved changes, if you export it like this, the unsaved changes will not be taken into account in the exported configuration.\nDo you want to save the configuration before exporting?
Moves the cursor back one character. If the cursor is at the beginning of the text, this action has no effect.
Sets the text position to a default box when selecting an image. This setting is just to save time, the position can then be changed manually.
Changes the voice used by the synthesis for "{}".
Speak the sentence with the selected parameters
Do you want to save the configuration before launching use mode?
Add a column from a key
Write the predicted character entered in the key.\nIf no character is predicted, this action will have no effect.
Change the size of the progress bar
Corrects words whose accent or cedilla has been forgotten, allows you to enter your text without accents and not disrupt the prediction
Keep only the most relevant words
Simulate left mouse click at cursor position
The video is played from the beginning each time the key is activated. If the video is already playing, this restarts it.
Allows you to authorize a direct selection even when the current mode is a scrolling mode. This can be very useful to accompany a person while scrolling
Allows you to generate an event if the configuration is launched on a specified day of the week and a specific time is reached.
Enables or disables recording for a clinical study session. This will then make it possible to use the study recordings to produce statistics.
The end time of the desired time interval in the event, in a readable format.
Allows you to adjust the height of the window in use mode
Write the text "{}" in the text editor then say "{}"
Key that will be held or released
Allows you to automatically change the opacity of the window in use mode when the mouse is no longer present in the LifeCompanion window. This can be useful for on-screen keyboards for example.
Moves the grid up in the list of grids in the stack.
Modifies the information of the selected configuration
Cannot open "{}" because it does not exist
There are {} items selected ({} image(s) in total)\nAre you sure you want to delete them?\nImages contained in the selected folders will also be deleted.
Allows you to move to the next keys in all lists of a specific level (or lower)
Enable/disable preservation of configuration aspect ratio
The text spoken by the synthesis when the key is activated.\nBy default it is equal to the text to write.\nIf "Speak" is disabled, the text is not spoken.
Name the added grid to easily find it later.
You have configuration changes that are not saved. By closing this window, these changes will be lost.
If enabled, displays visual feedback to the user which allows them to view the progress of scrolling on the current element.
Event fired every time the value of the selected variable changes
The window size will be multiplied by the percentage above. So a percentage of 200% will double the size of the window.
Reduces the size of the selected item from below. This will add elements on top to fill the space
The color that should be removed from the image and then replaced with another. For example, to remove a white background, select "White"
Event generated when scrolling is initiated for the current configuration (on startup or after a pause).
Add your images directly from folders
Opens the list of profile configurations
Overwrite configuration in profile\nand replace with the imported one

Allows you to select keys by automatic vertical scrolling. The keys scroll first on the first column, then on the following ones.\n Hover actions will be triggered when the scroll reaches above the key.
Contains the current score (modified by "Game Mechanics" actions).
{} could not be installed because it is not possible to create temporary installation folders.\nPlease restart the installation with administrator rights.
Sets the color of the outline when the user makes a selection.
Contains the text currently entered in the configuration's text editor.
Search for an action by name or description
Contains the percentage of the current score compared to the maximum possible score. Allows to display a "success" compared to an expected maximum score.
Unable to record sound, check computer microphone
Enable/disable pronunciation of communication key text
Speaks the text written in the key with the currently selected text-to-speech.
{} could not be installed because it is not possible to contact the installation server. Thank you try again later.
Enter a name for this configuration.\nIt is this name that will allow you to select the configuration later.
Allows you to move to the previous step in the current sequence
Opens the virtual mouse settings.\nThis allows you to modify its speed, appearance, etc.
You can add the image to a key by dragging it onto it.\nYou can also organize your gallery by dragging items into its folders.\nClick on an item to rename it.
Allows you to launch a command and arguments from LifeCompanion. The action will complete directly (even if the command execution is not completed). Errors and I/O are ignored.
Import a list of cases in json
Allows you to add additional resources to LifeCompanion. For example, allows you to add the Makaton image base for association members.
Reduces the size of the selected item from above. This will add items underneath to fill the space
Allows you to dynamically display the configurations available in the profile so you can switch from one to the other.
Go to the next level or perform the following actions
Contains actions relating to configuration selection mode. Allows you to modify its behavior, for example pause scrolling...
Disables the placement helper grid, you can now place components in the configuration as you see fit.
The video loops in the key without requiring any user action
No configuration.\nTo add new configurations, click "Add configuration"
Import a list of cases in json
The configuration cannot be loaded because it uses one or more extensions:
The presence of updates will be checked the next time LifeCompanion starts if the computer is correctly connected to the internet.
Button to move to the next item
Saves the configuration in the list of configurations of the current profile
Allows you to automatically switch from one image bank to another: for each image from the original bank, an image from the replacement bank will be proposed if available.
Writes the label ("{}") of the key
You have {} unsaved modification(s) in the current configuration, these will be lost.\nDo you really want to continue?
Allows you to take an image from the cameras available on your system
Allows you to configure the words displayed when predicting the next word. Also allows these words to be adapted to the current user's vocabulary.

Opens preferences and information about LifeCompanion.\nAllows you to modify certain global information in LifeCompanion (configuration window, proxy, etc.).\nThe preferences are not specific to the current configuration.
Cannot add action "{}" because it is incompatible with the element you are trying to add it to.
When this option is activated, the font size will be determined automatically so that the entire text fits into the key if it is too large. This will not enlarge the text if it is too small.
Writes the text of the key that launches the action.
If enabled, when the mouse leaves the application the opacity changes.
If the pointer remains for this amount of time (in seconds) on a square, then the hover actions are triggered.
Opens the list of LifeCompanion profiles.\nAllows you to modify them (name, color, etc.), but also to open another profile.\nAlso allows you to import/export a profile.
Displays the actions menu available for the actions list
Adds a key from the left to the selected key. This will shift the grid keys to the right and remove the last key
Use of {} / {} word(s) ({}% of base dictionary)
This is a text from the editor
Allows you to delete all temporary files used by LifeCompanion to reclaim disk space.
Removes the selected style from the profile styles list

Imports a configuration from an "lcc" file and adds it to the list of profile configurations. This allows you to recover a configuration made on another machine. If the configuration already exists in LifeCompanion, it will offer you to replace it.
Event fired when sound is turned on
Activates or deactivates speech synthesis depending on its current state. If voice synthesis is deactivated, no sound can be produced by it.
If activated, it will be possible even in hover selection with delay to select a key as in direct selection.\nThis allows a clickable user to make selections more quickly.
Replicates the mouse wheel down action (to move down in a scrollable item)
Generates an event when you are within a time interval defined for a day of the week.
Contains the current date in a readable format.
Moves the cursor to the end of the text in the editor.
Add a grid to the stack
Are you sure you want to delete profile "{}".\nThis action will result in the deletion of {} configurations associated with this profile.
Shows the current step in the currently selected sequence.
Select a variable to integrate. The variable will then be replaced by its value when using this configuration.
Change the text to be spoken in the communication key
Link to another list or grid?
The selected file is not a configuration/profile file for LifeCompanion, or the file is corrupt.
Replacing a Grid in a Stack
Add an image to the gallery (unitary)
Enable/disable use of configuration selection mode
The color of the virtual mouse cursor outline.
Search for images in folders and subfolders of {}
Allows you to manage key styles: add, delete or modify existing styles
You have {} unsaved modification(s) in the current configuration, these will be lost.\nDo you really want to continue?
When capital letters are enabled for the current configuration.
Plays the sound from the {} file in LifeCompanion.
The new value of the variable for which we want to track each change
LifeCompanion default prediction, allows you to predict any type of characters (including special characters)
(text of the current step of the sequence)
Opens the usage mode configuration window: allows you to set the starting element, the keyboard or the virtual mouse
Exports the profile to an "lcp" file and thus allows it to be imported into LifeCompanion on another machine.

This event is triggered when the user selects the "Go to top level" action and there is no possible top level. For example, it allows you to give audible feedback to indicate that you cannot go back any further.
Change the color of the progress display
Event triggered when sound is turned off
Change the number of scrolls before returning
Clone the style of a key to other keys
Name of the keyboard key pressed. This name is not translated.
Allows you to define a total number of times the grid/row/column must be scrolled before returning to the element above.\nAllows scrolling to automatically go back if the user made a wrong selection.
Go back to the previous step or close the window.\nThe changes made will be preserved.
Contains event triggers relating to the current configuration. For example when the sound is activated/deactivated in the configuration, capital letters, etc...
Writes the text "{}" in the text editor

Allows you to select using a virtual cursor other than that of the mouse. This can be moved by different interaction methods (eye pointing system, head pointing system, API, etc.). Selection mode under development.
Increases the size of the configuration window by the specified percentage.
Allows you to export all the grids of the configuration to a PDF file for example to print them.
Allows you to rotate the image 90° to the left
Enables or disables full full screen for the current window.
The more the correction is accumulated, the more it will be possible to suggest words distant from the user's initial input.\nPlease note, a cumulative correction may take a little longer to display.
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the top left of the screen
Simulate the activation of a key
The color that will be put in place of the old color. You can choose transparent with custom colors.
Allows you to modify the name of the selected model
Moves to previous keys in the currently displayed list. When the start of the list is reached, it automatically loops to the end of the list.
Contains general actions which allow actions to be combined with each other, or other...
Place the text below the image
Select an event to be able to add actions to it.
Exits LifeCompanion: closes the window and exits without asking for confirmation
Allows you to set the maximum possible score value. This value allows you to obtain an up-to-date score percentage based on a maximum possible score.
Allows you to add/remove columns to the selected grid.\nColumns are added/removed to the right of the grid.
Are you sure you want to remove the "{}" extension?
Change extra time on first element
Write then speak the text in the key "{}"
Increases the size of the selected item from above. This can reduce the height of the elements above, or remove some
An error occurred while recording sound
To exit full screen mode, press F11 or the icon at the top left.
Allows you to manage the background color of the configuration, its size, the window parameters...
Deletes the character directly after the cursor. This action provides the same behavior as pressing the "Del" key on a keyboard
This configuration already exists in profile "{}"
Search for a configuration by name, description...
You have just tried to launch LifeCompanion when it was already launched.\nFor the proper functioning of LifeCompanion, you cannot launch it several times at the same time.
Move the cursor to the line below if possible
Deletes the last selected word prediction. Allows you to “cancel” your last word prediction selection.
Allows you to change elements of the style of the selected keys.
Create a configuration from a template
Duplicates the currently displayed grid and adds it to the grid stack
If enabled, switches the image to black and white.
Import a profile file from the computer.
Do you still want to restart LifeCompanion?
Test the currently selected pronunciation change
Change the size of images in a text editor
The extension "{}" does not have a sufficient version (current version: {}, required version {})
Add a different pronunciation for the summary
Pronounce at the start of the step
Allows you to indicate this box as the next one to fill: this action allows you to use the contents of the next box with the action "Fill the marked box" (text, image, video, etc.).
Allows you to enlarge the key currently hovered over by the pointer or by scrolling.

You can separate the different arguments with spaces. If you want to have an argument containing spaces, surround it with quotes. For example, the argument: read "My file", will give two arguments: "read" and "My file"
Allows you to move to previous keys in all lists of a specific level (or lower)
Mark as box to be filled
This menu is reserved for experienced users! Do not use these options unless you know their consequences.
Integration of word prediction from the PREDICT4ALL project.
Speaks the text set for this key
Create a configuration from a template

When the pressure (the click, the pressure on the screen...) is maintained for a defined time, this event is generated.\nIt is generated as soon as the timer is reached, which means that even if several triggers of the same type are added, they will all send events in turn.
Close the tips window.\nTo disable this window at startup, you can go to your preferences.
Allows you to correct substitutions, by defining the change of one or more letters by one or more other letters. A rule of this type can also be applied in both directions.
Allows you not to automatically start scrolling. If enabled, the user will have to make a first selection "in a vacuum" for the scrolling to begin.
The start time of the desired time interval in the event, in a readable format.
Opens the menu to change the type of all selected keys.\nAllows you to change to a key for prediction, quick communication, etc.

It seems that the email entered "{}" does not have access to Makaton Bank. You can check:
- that you have entered the same email as the one used to log in to the AAD Makaton member area
- that your membership is valid

If your membership has just been created or renewed, it may sometimes be necessary to wait 24 hours before having access to Makaton Bank for LifeCompanion.
Allows you to use variables in the key text and have the key automatically updated by LifeCompanion.
Allows in the current list to go back to the level above (front list), in order to go back
File to open with default application
Allows you to quickly create a key with written text as well as spoken text, all configurable from the selection tab.

The selected video file does not appear to be usable. This may be due to a video file format that is incompatible with LifeCompanion. LifeCompanion is compatible with "MP4" video files (the most common video file format).
Go to the next page in the list of profile configurations
Allows you to adjust the general parameters of this configuration (selection mode, window appearance, word prediction, etc.)
You have {} unsaved modification(s) in the current configuration.\nWhat do you want to do ?
The last character in the text editor
Deletes the character directly before the cursor. As long as the selection is held, the deletion is repeated, like holding the "Backspace" key on a keyboard
The model could not be loaded:\n
Allows you to link to another list of keys. This is useful to avoid duplicating lists and thus save time editing.
Go to the "{}" grid and return to the next selection.
Simulates pressing the mouse wheel. This action does not occur depending on the virtual mouse
No extensions found in the selected file (or the extensions found are already in LifeCompanion)
Enter use mode with current configuration
Adds a key, this key will allow you to quickly enter the text to write when the key is activated, and the text to pronounce.

Allows you to select a key by placing the cursor above it for a defined duration. This mode is ideal for people who can move the cursor but cannot validate. However, it is possible to directly select a key for faster selection.
Occurs when the activation request is made at the right time.
Removing an item from a grid
Pastes the previously copied element, depending on the selected element, this will add the element to the stack, or replace a square in a grid.

When enabled, when the text of a key is entered, this automatically searches for and selects an image for this key if it does not yet have an image. The image can then be changed by searching for it manually.
Spells a chosen text with the currently selected text-to-speech.
Time and day of the week
Contains the maximum possible score (modified by "Game Mechanics" actions).
Perform the action for the level (or lower)
{} image(s) from this bank used in the configuration
The video will be played and displayed directly in the key. The reading mode will allow you to choose when to trigger the reading.
Coupled with a "Go to grid and return" action, allows you to avoid returning to the previous grid after executing an action on an element.
Writes a tab after the cursor in the text editor.
Adds a grid to the current stack. The added grid maintains the layout and style of the currently displayed grid.
Change the image of the "{}" key
Allows you to display the initial level of key lists
Moves the grid down in the list of grids in the stack.
Contains the actions relating to the sequences defined for this configuration. Actions allow you to move to the item
Change the value of a style element
Name of the element currently hovered over (by mouse in direct selection, or while scrolling for other modes)
Contains the name of the LifeCompanion profile currently in use
Allows you to adjust the space between lines entered in the text editor.
Add an item to this list
Exports the configuration to a file on the computer, this allows you to reuse the configuration on another computer, or on a mobile.

If disabled, allows you to change the selection mode only for this grid.\nThis allows for example to have a particular selection mode for this grid, or to simply change a parameter (eg: scrolling time).
Change the background color of the configuration

Manual scrolling allows you to use two switches: one to move from one element to another, and one to activate an element. Automatic scrolling moves from one element to another automatically, and the switch is only used to validate
Removes this user profile from the list of profiles and associated configurations on this machine.
Contains events generated by interaction with LifeCompanion functions. For example, allows you to react to the end of a timer.
Text position when selecting an image
If enabled, automatically adds a space in the editor after text written by this key.
Adds a grid to the hovered grid stack
Size and position changed from {} to {}
Change the way actions are triggered
Stops speech synthesis if pronunciation is in progress. The following pronunciation actions will not be impacted
Creating the LifeCompanion log ZIP file
Allows you to select keys by selecting (click/press) directly on them.\nHover actions will be triggered when the cursor passes over the key.
Allows you to adjust the size of the outline.\nThe higher the size, the thicker the outline will be.
Do you want to open a configuration?
Changes the horizontal space between grid lines

Allows you to select keys by automatic horizontal scrolling. The keys scroll first on the first line, then on the following ones.\n Hover actions will be triggered when the scroll reaches above the key.
Box to be marked as "to be filled in"
The higher the level, the more elements that are not on hover will be hidden
Here you can import a file containing words to favor or disfavor. Your file must contain one word per line and be in ".txt" format. Unknown words from the prediction dictionary will be ignored.
This action opens the notepad with the note saved on this key, then closes it the second time. Be careful, opening Notepad erases the text currently in the editor.
Allows you to write a text in the text editor, and optionally to pronounce this or another text.
Allows you to define the starting grid of the configuration.\nThis grid will be displayed when user mode starts. If the selection is scrolling, scrolling will begin for that grid.
Adds a new style to the profile styles list
Imports a computer configuration file into the profile configurations list
Do you want to save before importing another configuration?
Reduces the size of the item selected from the left. This will add elements to the left to fill the space
Allows you to add the same actions to all selected keys.\nThis saves time when several keys will have the same action.
Simulates pressing "{}" key(s) on the keyboard until activation is released.
Allows you to manage shape styles: add, delete or modify existing styles
Calculation time of the last result: {} ms\nMemory: {}/{} (max: {})
Allows you to duplicate this configuration and thus make modifications to a new version without modifying the current version. The duplicate configuration will be added in the profile configurations.
Allows you to trigger the mouse in pointing by scrolling with crossed lines, to stop it and to left click at the intersection of the two lines.
Allows you to duplicate the selected configuration so that you can have two versions of the same configuration.

Please note, extensions necessary for the proper functioning of this configuration are not loaded. You can try to install them (internet connection required) or continue without: you will be able to use the configuration but it may not be loaded correctly.
Contains events generated by interaction with sequence functions. For example, allows you to react at the end of a sequence.
You are going to add an action to one or more boxes of the box list. This action will be associated with the box in the grid and not with its content (its text, its image, etc.).

If enabled, pauses before and after text-to-speech pronunciation are removed. This allows for better responsiveness. May be useful to disable if LifeCompanion is used with external audio devices (e.g. Bluetooth).
Press time required to trigger activation (s)

The Mulberry Symbols, or Pictograms, are a set of scalable SVG graphic images designed for communications use. They are ideal for adults using AAC software or devices or any online accessibility use where their liberal license ensures unrestricted use, copying and distribution.\nCreative Commons License (BY-SA)
Move the cursor to the line above if possible
If enabled, the created profile will have this configuration in its list of available configurations by default.

Your profile indicates a user level (Beginner, Normal or Expert).

Depending on the level chosen on the profile, different elements of the configuration interface will be displayed or hidden.

You can change your profile level in the Profile Manager.
Please note: an "Expert" profile will allow you to access all possible parameters, but the configuration interface will be more complex.
Allows you to indicate a selected box as the next one to fill: this action allows you to use the contents of the next box with the action "Fill the marked box" (text, image, video, etc.).

When the pressure (the click, the pressure on the screen, etc.) is maintained for a defined time, and then released.\nThe event is generated when the pressure is released, not once the time is reached. If several triggers of this type are added, the last one whose time is reached will be triggered.\nHaving an event triggered overrides the default behavior of the current selection mode (does not trigger hover key actions).

Event generated when a mouse button is pressed. Be careful, this may conflict with the current selection mode if it uses the mouse.

Allows you to define substitutions that always occur between a set of expressions. For example, it is possible to define confusion between all verbal inflections.

If activated, the text entered in the "Speak" field will be spoken by voice synthesis, otherwise, it will not be taken into account.
Initializes a new user profile in LifeCompanion and allows you to use it.

You cannot close LifeCompanion in usage mode. To close LifeCompanion, enter "Edit" mode or turn off this setting.

Copyright 2008-2017 Garry Paxton | Copyright 2018 Steve Lee

It is not always easy to find the elements in its configurations, especially if it contains many piles and grids.\nThanks to the selection panel, you can see the tree of all the elements of the current configuration, this also includes the elements that are not visible on the screen (because they are below, or invisible).\nYou can explore this tree to understand the organization of your configuration. You can also search for an item by name, and then click on it to select it.
Failed to import the words to prioritize, please check your file.
Pressure maintained for more than {} seconds and then released.
Change the pronunciation of the summary
If enabled, allows you to replace the background color of the image with a transparent color.
The duration of the interval between two events, in a readable format.
Activates the placement help grid, this grid will only be visible in edit mode. It allows you to better place the elements in relation to each other.
Adds a key, this key can only contain chosen letters and will be automatically moved as part of a letter prediction
Prints the editor text to the printer selected by default for this computer. If the text does not fit on one page, this will print as many pages as necessary.
Adds a grid in a key, in order to be able to create "sub-grids"
Removes the configuration from the list of configurations of the current profile

Configuration events allow you to perform one or more actions when a general event occurs on the configuration, without necessarily being linked to the selection of a key. This makes it possible, for example, to perform an action with each letter entered on the keyboard, with each new word entered in the text field, or even when selection mode is started.\nEach event when it occurs will then trigger the actions associated with it.\nSome events can also generate variables for use in actions (for example, the letter entered in the editor)
\nDeleting this extension will therefore also remove the extensions listed above.

Useful for users using only part of the vocabulary. Allows you to automatically favor or disfavor a set of words. This will not remove other words but will favor or disfavor the appearance of words from predefined lists. It is also possible to use custom lists.
If images are enabled in the editor, define their height.\nThe taller an image is, the more visible it will be in the editor, however the lines will therefore be more spaced apart.
Allows you to launch a program on the system
Deletes the selected element, depending on the selected element, this will remove a grid from the stack, or replace the component with an empty key
An unexpected error has occurred in LifeCompanion, we are sorry.\n Please restart LifeCompanion.
Allows you to adjust the width of the configuration (and therefore add or remove margins around the components)
Allows you to move the virtual mouse cursor to the right of the screen
If sounds are playing, this stops them playing. The next sound playback actions will work normally.
The day reached in the event, in a readable format
Do you want to save before closing it?
If enabled, replaces one color in the image with another.\nThis function is very useful if you want to remove the background from an image.
Opens a specified folder in the system's file explorer
Complete full screen window (without title bar)

Allows you to choose a custom name for this item.\nIf no name is chosen then the name is determined automatically (key text, grid number, etc.).\nIf you enter a name, then this element will always use that name regardless of its content.
Simulate right mouse click at cursor position
No model for the type sought
Spells the text written in the key with the currently selected text-to-speech.
Contains all actions to display a grid, move from one grid to another, go to the next page...
Displays the list to be able to add an action to the current element
Allows you to correct an addition of one or more letters.
Counts down from a chosen duration and updates the displayed progress bars.
Go to the next grid in the stack "{}"
Goes to the next page in the sequence list. If the last page is reached, returns to the first page.
Failed to send comment, please try again later.
Contains the percentage of battery currently remaining. Only valid for machines with a battery.

In order to add Makaton Bank, you must enter the email used to log in to your AAD Makaton member area. Your membership must be valid and have been created/renewed for at least 24 hours.\nUse of Makaton Bank is limited to three installations of LifeCompanion.
Allows you to reset the default value to the style that will be changed.
Simulates hovering over a selected key, as if the user had hovered over it with the mouse or scrolled using configuration selection mode
Moves the cursor to the beginning of the text in the editor.
Event generated when scrolling is stopped/paused for the current configuration (at startup or after when paused).
Event generated when a mouse button is released. Be careful, this may conflict with the current selection mode if it uses the mouse.
Initializes a new configuration in the current user profile, and then allows you to use it. This configuration will be empty and will need to be completed.
Show menu: allows you to add a manual rule, category or delete this rule/category
Go to the previous page in the list of profile configurations
This configuration already exists in this profile.\nIf you import this configuration, the existing configuration will be overwritten.\nAre you sure you still want to import the configuration?
Allows you to define the corrections during predictions that are suggested to the user.
Allows you to capitalize the first letter of the next written text, only done once.\nUseful for, for example, writing a proper name without having to press the shift key again.
Changing the name of an element
Change the display of information in the key type
Writes a space in the text editor.
Image "{}" could not be added to the gallery.\nVerify that this is a valid image.
LifeCompanion was already launched\nThis dialog will be automatically hidden in {} seconds

Are you sure you want to delete the current profile "{}".\nThis action will result in the deletion of {} configurations associated with this profile. Changes made to the current configuration will be lost.\nYou will need to select another profile to continue using LifeCompanion.
Allows you to display word predictions based on the text currently entered in the text editor.
Go to the grid and return
Unable to remove the grid from its stack because a grid stack cannot be empty. To remove it, first add a new grid to the stack.
If you export it like this, unsaved changes will not be taken into account in the exported configuration.\nDo you want to save the configuration before exporting?

No change in pronunciation.\nPronunciation changes allow you to automatically change one text to another just before it is pronounced by synthesis, which is useful for correcting synthesis errors for certain terms.\nTo add more, click on the “+”.
Opens "{}" in the system's default Internet browser.
Divides the selected element to have keys again in place of an element that takes up more than one key in height or width
Contains the remaining battery time estimated by the system. Only valid for machines with a battery.

You can separate the different arguments with spaces. If you want to have an argument containing spaces, surround it with quotes. For example, the argument: read "My file", will give two arguments: "read" and "My file"
Fixes forgetting a letter inside a word (all letters of the alphabet)

Before this number of letters, no correction will be offered to the user. By setting 2, this allows for example to only trigger the integration of corrections into the prediction once two letters have been entered. The correction will still apply to the entire word.
When the selection is validated upon release, allows you to define the minimum press time (in seconds) before the selection is taken into account.
Contains actions relating to applications accessible in LifeCompanion (notes, etc.)
Remove a column from a key
The desired time in the event, in a readable format.
To display "debug" information, activate this mode in the "General" tab
If activated, the word will never be proposed in the predictions displayed to the user
Moves to the next keys in the currently displayed list. When the end of the list is reached, it automatically loops to the start of the list.
There are currently {} unsaved changes in the current configuration.\nChanging your profile will result in the loss of these changes, are you sure you want to change your profile?
Adds a grid stack in the configuration. The grid stack is the root element that allows you to add grids and keys into a configuration.
Allows you to open a file with the computer's default application. For example, by putting a ".doc" file, this will open this file with the word processor defined by default on the computer.
Simulates the activation of a selected key, as if the user had activated it using configuration selection mode
If enabled, when the user changes configuration in usage mode, then displays a shortcut at the top left to return to the previous configuration.
Increases the size of the item selected on the left. This can reduce the width of the elements on the left, or remove them
Fixes missing a space or apostrophe between two words. However, both words must be correct originally.
Imports a configuration file from the computer and opens it in LifeCompanion
This frame allows you to crop the image or crop it. To reduce the size of the image, you can enlarge the frame. You can also move the frame to display only part of the image.
Adds a notepad key. This key allows you to save text typed in the text editor to display it again later.
Changes the size of the window to put it at maximum size (with title bar) or at its base size if it was already at maximum size.
Speak when hovering over the key
Event triggered when speech synthesis is enabled
Enables or disables the sound produced when playing sound type multimedia files. When sound playback is disabled, no sound will be produced during playback.
Contains all media-related actions: play sound, change music, etc...
If enabled, prevents the user from closing LifeCompanion when it is in use mode. Can be useful when you only want to use hardware for LifeCompanion and not allow the user to "exit" into the system.
Allows you to say the last word in the editor.
Allows you to select a file from the computer as the image for this item.
Change the text of a key
No items selected\nTo select an element, you can click on it directly,\nor you can select it in the selection panel (on the left in the selection tab)
Preparing the installation, this may take a few minutes...
Allows you to speak the sentence currently being written in the editor.
Allows you to retrieve the image currently in the clipboard
Allows you to select the speech synthesis engine to use.\nThe engine changes the sound rendering of a sentence pronounced by the synthesis. It may depend on the system on which LifeCompanion is used.

It may happen that the speech synthesis does not pronounce certain words as it should. For example, when using English terms with a French synthesis, the pronunciation may leave something to be desired.
It is therefore possible to automatically correct the speech synthesis on certain incorrect terms.

Take for example the term "LifeCompanion", the summary does not pronounce "Companion" with the correct accent. In order to simulate this accent she must pronounce "Companione". We can therefore add an exception which automatically replaces "LifeCompanion" with "LifeCompanione".
Corrects the most classic errors of forgetting or adding a double letter.
Contains events relating to key lists: Event when changing list, going back, etc.
This is an example of text spoken using text-to-speech.
Add images from computer to gallery

Set this configuration as the one to run by default. The next time LifeCompanion is opened, this configuration will therefore be launched immediately for the user without going through the configuration interface.
Do you want to save before creating a new configuration?
Show tips and tricks on startup

Unable to export profile to file "{}"
Helps identify the element being hovered over when selecting by reducing the elements in the background
If activated, the size of the configuration will be automatically defined according to the elements that compose it.\nOtherwise, this allows you to manually adjust the configuration size.
Allows you to define how the space will be written when predicted by character prediction.\nFor example, you can choose to display "Space" rather than a single character.
Remove a different pronunciation for synthesis

Creating a backup backup of the configuration
Inserts a line break at the cursor location.

Contains actions that allow you to control the keyboard and virtual mouse and launch programs.\nContains everything you need to control your computer using LifeCompanion.

Installation completed, thank you for your patience
Deletes the last word before the cursor present in the text editor.
Allows you to insert a variable into the text. A variable is a value that will be replaced by its current value when using the text. For example the current time when the text is used.
Applies the initially copied style to the selected elements (stacks, grids, keys, etc.)

If you have images on your computer that you want to use in your setup, you don't necessarily have to import them into LifeCompanion's gallery.\nSimply open the folder containing the images, then drag and drop images into the keys that should contain them. The images will then be automatically added to the gallery and placed on the key. Practical !
Lists of actions, events and variable information

LifeCompanion, digital assistant mainly dedicated to helping with communication and computer access. LifeCompanion is developed by the Electronics Laboratory of the Mutualist Center for Rehabilitation and Functional Rehabilitation of Kerpape (Lorient, France) and distributed free of charge under the open-source GNU General Public License.\nNo use or commercial exploitation is authorized without explicit agreement from the CMRRF of Kerpape
Place the text to the left of the image
Multiple items selected\nSelect the item to modify.
Changes the text contained in a key. This action has no effect if the text is determined automatically (for example on a prediction key, etc.)
Pressure maintained for X seconds and released
Allows greater replacement to be tolerated.\nThe higher the tolerance, the more colors similar to the color to be replaced will be replaced.
Write the text in the key
Adds a key with variable information. This means that the contents of the key can be determined from existing variables.
Changes the voice used by the synthesis to "{}" then returns to the old one.
Actions when the selected event is triggered
Number of uses before considering a valid word
User model size:\n{}\nApproximate weight of user model: {}%
The text written in the editor when the key is activated.\nBy default it is equal to the text in the key.
Allows you to display a progress indicator (bar, circle, etc.) that can be used for sequences to know the elapsed or remaining time.
The configuration has been duplicated and added to your configuration list.
Generate an event when one is a {}
Inverts the image on the vertical axis
Change the horizontal spacing of a grid
If disabled, then the image will be stretched to take up all the space.\nActivated, it will never distort the image.
Allows you to add a new configuration to the current user profile.\nThe configuration can be created from scratch, imported, duplicated from an existing configuration...
Please note: extensions allow you to modify the behavior and configurations of LifeCompanion.\nTo be safe, only install extensions that come from a trusted source.
Time interval for a day of the week
Deletes the character directly after the cursor. As long as the selection is held, the deletion is repeated, like holding the "Del" key on a keyboard
Change the spacing between lines in a text editor
Changes the image contained in a key. Replaces the currently selected image with a selected image.
Allows you to display a predicted character based on the characters currently entered in the editor. The proposed character is free.
If enabled, avoids cutting words in the middle when the text is too long to display on a single line.
Simulates pressing one or more keyboard keys until activation is released.\nPlease note that for this action to work, the configuration must be in virtual keyboard mode.

This action will allow you to go up to the level defined above (level 0 = root of the key lists) or otherwise to execute the following actions of the key if the level is not yet reached. This makes it possible, for example, to integrate an action on the same square to move up the list of squares or to do something else when the desired level has already been reached.
Exports the configuration to an "lcc" file and thus allows it to be imported into LifeCompanion on another machine.

If enabled, the configuration will be a configuration used to serve as a virtual keyboard.\nThis means that text entered in LifeCompanion will also be entered in the selected text fields in the background.\nPlease note, if this mode is activated, LifeCompanion will not be able to detect keyboard key presses.
This part allows you to manage the general styles used in the configuration. A change here will change all elements of the configuration that do not have a particular style.

Parlerpictos is a bank of pictograms which was developed and produced by teachers, orthopedagogues, speech therapists and occupational therapists, members of the Center for Oral and Written Communication (CSCOE-Québec), in search of pictograms corresponding more to the Quebec reality and the needs of people deprived of their voice.\nCreative Commons License (BY-NC-SA)

Allows you to go back to the level above (front list) in the current list, in order to go back to a certain defined level. As long as it is possible to go back, the actions to follow are not executed. If the desired level is reached, the next actions in the key are executed.

Efficient and lightweight open-source word prediction incorporating in-progress word correction. It is not uncommon to have to use the same key style on several different keys.\nIn order to apply the same style to all your keys, it is very simple to modify the style on a single key, then apply it to several other keys. You can select the key whose style should be copied, then select as many keys as you want where the style will be applied.

Corrects poor written transcription of phonemes, allows you to write phonetically without disrupting the prediction.

Change the background color of a key

When you want to add an image to your configurations, it is not uncommon for the background to be white. Sometimes, if the key that contains the image is not white, we would still like to put the image without seeing the background.\n\nIn LifeCompanion it's very simple, you just have to replace the background color of the image with a chosen color (transparent to make it disappear). Thanks to the "Tolerance" parameter you can adjust the sensitivity of the replacement, and thus avoid seeing too much of the edges of the image. The image is now free of its background.
Cancels and closes the actions menu
Moves to previous keys in the currently displayed list. When the start of the list is reached, the action no longer has an effect.

Allows you to change the voice used by the synthesis, as does the “Change synthesis voice” action. But this action restores the old summary once all actions have been completed.

It can be convenient to have global actions in LifeCompanion, without having to program a key to do so, especially when the user selects keys while scrolling. It is possible to trigger actions when the user holds the selection for a certain time.

This behavior uses LifeCompanion events:
 1. Add a “Pressure maintained X seconds” event: it is this event which will define the visual/audible feedback of our maintained selection
 2. Associate the desired actions with this event. It is convenient to add the "Change selection mode activation color" action because the selection outline will change color when the selection is held long enough. You can also add a sound, or a speech synthesis output.
 3. Add an event “Pressure held for X seconds and released”: it is to this event that our actions to the prolonged selection will be added.
 4. Associate the extended selection actions: it is common to associate global actions such as "Speak all text" or "Start scrolling again".

Note that it is possible to have the same event several times: for example, you can say all the text at 2 seconds, and start scrolling again at 5 seconds.
If the pointer remains for this time (in seconds) on a key, then the actions upon activation are triggered.
Clear current selection of gallery items
Delete style modifications on selected elements (stacks, grids, keys, etc.)
You cannot modify the "{}" action because it is attached to its case type.\nTo modify it, change the associated key type, or use the “Selection” tab.

The key type allows this key to have a particular behavior.\nSelecting may also give you access to a quicker configuration of the key (e.g. "Quick communication")
Allows you to limit the number of times the line goes back and forth before stopping.
Duplicates an existing profile in LifeCompanion. Allows you to create a new profile from another, and thus modify its configurations independently.
Unable to import profile from file "{}"

It is very easy to make a style change on several keys at the same time.
 1. Select the keys whose style must be changed (Ctrl + Click)
 2. Click “Change style”
 3. Select the items to change. Different elements are represented by a star.
 4. Click “Apply”

Only items that have changed (with a star) will be modified on the selected keys.
Create a style only for this element, the style will not appear in the profile styles list, and will be unique to this element.\nThis function is used to quickly create a style.
Change the synthesis voice then return to the old one
Displays the different sequences available in the configuration. Pressing the box starts the sequence.

These setup templates are provided to get you started in LifeCompanion. They come from the clinical experience of the designers of LifeCompanion and the different treatments. The vocabulary of the proposed configurations is often simple and must be adapted and supplemented according to use. Don't forget that a configuration can then be adapted, both in its content (text, actions, images, etc.) and in its mode of interaction (direct pointing, scrolling, etc.).\nYou can find more configurations on the LifeCompanion platform configurations directory.
Enable/disable enlargement of keys on hover
Changes the pencil size to a selected size
The camera is not connected or it is inaccessible. Check the connections or that it is not open in another application.
Starts operating mode with current configuration
Shows additional actions for the gallery

You can change elements of the key style.\nEach changed element (represented by a star) will be applied, unchanged elements will not be modified. Each deleted item (represented by the trash can) will be reset to its default value.
